cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles ESE of Marathon, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the Florida Keys / southeast Gulf of Mexico and toward the central Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana–Mississippi–Alabama) late Tuesday into Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the mouth of the Mississippi River, southeast Louisiana

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama–Florida border westward to east of Morgan City, LA, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Watch from the Mississippi-Alabama border westward to the mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and southern Florida today; central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through Alabama and Mississippi Tuesday–Wednesday
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Tuesday night into Wednesday with a 30 % chance of sustained 34-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor river surge of 1–2 ft could propagate up the lower Mississippi River; major (>3 ft) surge not expected at the port’s location.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain possible Tuesday night–Wednesday; localized higher totals could cause freshwater flooding and operational delays.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated river levels, debris, and possible navigation restrictions on the Mississippi River channel.
